main.name: Pranava S Balugari
main.jobDescription: full stack software engineer working in mental health space.
main.bio: I am an athlete at heart, with an entrepreneurial spirit, and a passion for coding. I pursued my first development job 5+ years ago with Fairfax. I was hired as a full stack developer by Fairfax and now by Innowell, where I work today. Since beginning my career I have been tinkering with multiple languages and have affinity towards DevOps space. I am currently working towards completing AWS certifications and gaining knowledge in GoLang while working as a full stack developer.
main.contactmessage: Have a project for me? Think I'd be a good fit for your team? I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by email or by using the form below if you'd like to get in contact with me.

resume.skillmessage: I'm a tinkerer and am always interested in playing around with new technologies but these are the ones that have really won me over

work.title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
work.description:
For most of my time at Innowell, I have worked as a Full Stack Software Engineer. Here I have had the chance to dig in and get my hands dirty with frontend side of our product. I have worked with our Ruby backend, as well as built node-based google cloud functions for the product. I have worked extensively with React/Redux as well as with react hooks. 

More recently, I started working on isolating frontend and backend of the huge monolith we have as a side project :).

work.title: Senior Software Engineer
work.description:
Worked on strategic initiatives on technology selection, prototypes development, research, development and process improvement.   
                             Encouraged test driven development as an integral part of delivering software development across the teams.    
                             Developed unit and integration tests and perform the validation using contemporary tools. Setup continuous development/continuous integration with Codeship and bitbucket.    
                             Proactively identify and communicate risks and issues to management and create action plans to mitigate risks    
                             Redesign the apps based on client and sales teams feedback.    
                             Coordinate with sales and product teams to increase the revenues of the product    
                             Coordinate with third party integrations to improve revenue stream.    
                             Manage team work per sprint and engaging peers in code reviews.    
                             Be part of a team and product owner to transform our delivery framework to an agile and iterative methodology    
                             Mentor junior developers and engage in peer technical discussions.    
                             Technology stack migrations (AngularJS to Angular, Rails 3 to 4, Rails 4 to 5)

work.title: Technology consultant II
work.description: In August 2010, I joined Hewlett Packard as a technology consultant for IVR products. I worked for Telefonica O2 UK, MTS India, HP Grenoble Conferencing Solutions, ‘Yes’ Optus  in a span of 3 years which helped me  learn, innovate and adapt to complex environments and customer rich applications. I worked with 'Yes' Optus through Hewlett Packard in Australia, supporting them to enhance their IVR Systems and Front end projects.

work.title: System engineer (Associate)
work.description: In May 2007, I got the opportunity to work with IBM India (GBS) as a System Engineer for 3 years  (Provisioning applications for AT&T). During the tenure, I gained experience in the software development life cycle process and also learned the techniques of efficient java/j2ee programming. I handled various modules independently, some of which also interacted with different sets of applications using technologies like web services. Interactions with workflow teams helped me build thinking process towards architecture and functioning of projects.

skills.name: Ruby
skills.description: I have used Ruby since i started working as a dev. All my office projects were based on Ruby backend both in Fairfax and Innowell.

skills.name: React Js
skills.description: I am fairly new to React and really did not like it at first. It has grown on me though and I will continue to use it going forward. I have used ReactJS at my time in Innowell. Migrated my personal site from AngularJS.

skills.name: Angular JS
skills.description: I enjoy AngularJS for it's ease of configuration and its ability to get a full stack prototype up and running quickly. I used AngularJS in two projects when i was in fairfax (AgTrader and Horsedeals).

skills.name: Bootstrap 4
skills.description: I use Bootstrap more often than not when designing the layout for my pet projects. It is the framework I am most familiar with and can therefore design more quickly than with others.

skills.name: GraphQL
skills.description: I have used this in Innowell as a layer b/w frontend and Database. Used it with react in the front end (react-relay) and used graphql-ruby gem in the backend.

skills.name: Heroku
skills.description: I use Heroku as my hosting platform for most of my pet projects because so far they are all unpaid and their free tier is convenient. I also have a hosted commercial project which is on enterprise tier. I love it's integration with Github for simple deployment.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control in small teams and have toyed around with contributing to Open Source Projects.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Java was my first programming language that I started using in college years ago. It is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure and algorithm programming.

skills.name: Node JS
skills.description: Node JS is my server-side scripting language of choice. The bulk of my experience with it has been in creating cloud functions in GCP and lambdas in AWS.

skills.name: GoLang
skills.description: I attended a Go Conference in 2019 and fell in love with it. Started working on a personal project called quickplan.io which is based on sprint esitmations.

projects.title: Canadian Wanderlust

projects.title: Fury Fighting Gear

projects.title: Smirkspace

testimonials.text: I have had the opportunity to work with Tim on multiple occasions which has always been a pleasure. He is driven and motivated with a consistently positive attitude. Tim excels at communicating with others and is always willing to work hard until he solves the problem at hand.
testimonials.user: Alastair Beaumont - Web Developer at AppColony
